pages.text: A $(item)Gas Lift/$ is a pump, basically. It uses $(l:base_concepts/pressure)pressure/$ to decrease the density of a liquid to force it upwards.$(p)When pressurized, it extrudes $(l:tubes/pressure_tubes)Pressure Tubes/$ (which you must provide) downwards until it hits any liquid, at which point it will pump it. This makes it perfect for $(l:base_concepts/oil)Oil/$ extraction, as Oil might be deep underground.

Any solid block in the way will be broken, without yield. Breaking blocks uses up air; this is a very small amount for soft blocks like dirt or sand, but much more for hard blocks such as obsidian. If you use $(l:tubes/pressure_tubes#advanced)Advanced Pressure Tubes/$, air usage is reduced by 50%.$(p)The air usage required to pump fluids scales linearly with the depth it is pumping at, i.e. the number of tubes currently extruded.

pages.title: Mode Tab
pages.text: The Gas Lift can be switched to one of 3 modes:$(li)$(#00f)Pump and allow empty tank/$ extrudes Pressure Tubes, pumping fluids when it encounters them.$(li)$(#00f)Pump and leave liquid in filter/$ does the same as above, but will always keep 1000mB of fluid in the tank. This is useful when pumping for a certain liquid, to make sure no other liquids will be pumped.
$(li)$(#00f)Draw in tubes/$ will make the $(thing)Gas Lift/$ stop pumping and retract any tubes it extruded, back into its inventory.
